subject: Philosophy
title: Stoicism and CBT
description: A 60-second lesson on Stoicism and CBT.

hook.text: The most evidence-based therapy in modern psychology was built on a 2,000-year-old philosophy.

buildup.text: Aaron Beck and Albert Ellis developed CBT in the 1960s. Both credited Epictetus as inspiration.

discovery.text: CBT's core idea: it's not events that upset you, but your beliefs about them. That's pure Stoicism.

twist.text: Epictetus said this in 100 CE. It took psychology nineteen centuries to put it into clinical practice.

climax.text: CBT is now the gold standard for treating anxiety and depression â€” Stoic wisdom with a lab coat.

punchline.text: The best modern therapy is ancient philosophy in disguise.

quiz.question: Which ancient Stoic philosopher directly inspired CBT?
